answers.answer: Yes it can happen. My cousin has diabetes and had a baby in April. He weighed 12 lbs 7 oz. Was a big baby. The docs knew she would have a toddler baby and scheduled her for a section. They are both healthy and well. It will be ok. Try not to worry too much. Good luck.
I was hoping to avoid a c section :-/

I had to have us with my son as well because he was measuring way ahead. They never did figure out why but I had him at 37 weeks and he was 7lbs 10ozs. So you might not need.c section. :) I think they just mess up due dates :p
Usually if they see baby is too big they will induce you so you can try a vaginal delivery...they thought my son was gonna be over 8lbs so I was induced at 38wks he came out at 6lbs15oz

Im 31+2 and they are estimating him at 5lbsthe already do you think my dr would really let me go full term if he's gonna be close to 14lbs by 40to weeks if their estimation is right? I asked on Tuesday if they were going to induce me early bc of the gestational diabetes and she said that it would be considered elective and they wouldn't put me on the list until 39weeks

question: So today im getting an ultrasound to see why bubs is measuring 4a weeks bigger than what he should be. Hubs has been teasing that I'm going to give birth to a 14lb kid so now I'm nervous I have gestational diabetes this time around and I know that could be part of it but is it normal for them to be that much bigger?
title: baby measuring big
